item.title: Structure of Code Block
item.description: Structure of Code Blocks Org offers two ways to structure source code in Org documents: in a source code block, and directly inline. Both specifications are shown below. #+NAME: <name> #+BEGIN_SRC <language> <switched> <header arguments> <body> #+END_SRC Do not be put-off by having to remember the source block syntax. Org mode offers a commmand for warpping existing text in a block. Org also works with other completrion systems in Emacs, some of which predate Org and have custom domain-specific languages for defining templates.
